visualization_prompt: Generate a spline chart showing hourly temperature variations in New York City using timezone-adjusted UTC timestamps
visualization_explanation: The dataset represents a 24-hour temperature profile with 3-hour resolution (n=12). Temporal variable uses ISO8601 datetime format (UTC basis with -4hr offset), while temperature values are quantitative (℉). Synthetic data follows diurnal patterns with μ=77.5°F, σ=8.2°F, showing characteristic daytime heating (09-18h) and nocturnal cooling phases. The spline chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating redundant gridlines while maintaining temporal continuity. Cairo's principles are applied through: 1) Monochromatic encoding for color vision deficiency 2) Direct time-temperature mapping without 3D distortion 3) Clear temporal anchors in local time format. The normal distribution approximation (μ±σ) in synthetic data reflects typical urban heat island thermal inertia.
